{"step_by_step_thinking": "Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID) is a group of rare disorders caused by mutations in different genes that result in severe impairment of both the humoral and cellular immune systems. According to the documents, IL2RG and JAK3 are involved in SCID. IL2RG gene is mentioned in Document [0] and Document [11] as being mutated in X-linked SCID. JAK3 is mentioned in Document [26] as one of the genes whose mutations can cause SCID. However, there is no mention of BTK and ZAP70 being involved in SCID in the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "A. BTK"}
